page.title: 14Barnsley Pool
page.content: By the farm yard,past yapping dogs and hissing geese, down the gulley between sandstone walls,wavey and red to the dark green pool,full of duck weed,ducks and larvae. Willows bend their heads the water's edge, cattle churn the mud to foam as they come to drink. So many plants and insects, some I have never seen before. Barnsley pool is long and narrow, it lies in the bottom of a natural dip, with rough pasture rising from its edges. Around the pool are a number of sandstone rocks and some very old trees.Living on and around the pool are a number of wild duck, they probably nest here in the Spring, they are close neighbours to the little darting moorhens who live under the old willow roots the whole year round.
